result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher P. Geniesse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

Absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Work out payment plan with agent.

supervisions.notes:
**See attached letter from DOC and approval memo from Court dated 4-25-16.
Amending extended supervision from 3 years to 2 years.**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Court imposes:  3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.294 days credit. Eligible for CIP & SAP.
Pay $200+costs= $719 + $250 DNA surcharge= $969- work out pay plan with agent
6 month DL suspension
No firearms or body armor
Def to give DNA sample
Extended supervision cond:

Perform 50 hours of community service every year
